natural problem:
Find all values of $x$ such that
\[
\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 & 1 \\ x & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix}
= 0.\]Enter your values separated by commas.  For example, if you think the possible values are 4, 5, and 6, then enter you answer as "4,5,6".
natural solution: Subtracting the second column from the first column, we get \[ \begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x - 7 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 - 343 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]The first column becomes all zeros when $x = 7,$ so this is one possible value of $x.$

Subtracting the third column from the first column, we get \[ \begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x + 2 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 + 8 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]The first column becomes all zeros when $x = -2,$ so this is another possible value of $x.$

Expanding the last determinant along the first column, we get \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x + 2 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 + 8 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} &= -(x + 2) \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} + (x^3 + 8) \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 7 & -2 \end{vmatrix} \\

&= -9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0. \end{align}Since we know that $x = 7$ are $x = -2$ are two solutions, we can take out a factor of $x - 7$ and $x + 2$, to get \[-9(x - 7)(x + 2)(x + 5) = 0.\]Hence, the possible values of $x$ are $\boxed{7, -2, \text{ and } -5}.$
(Alternatively, by Vieta's formulas, the sum of the three roots of $-9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0$ is 0, so the third root is $-7 - (-2) = -5.$)

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and det :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. det x = abs (1 * (7 * -8 - -2 * 343) - 1 * (x * -8 - -2 * x powr 3) + 1 * (x * 343 - 7 * x powr 3))"
and h1 : "det x = 0"
shows  "x = 7 \<or> x = -2 \<or> x = -5"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find all values of $x$ such that
\[
\begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 & 1 \\ x & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix}
= 0.\]Enter your values separated by commas.  For example, if you think the possible values are 4, 5, and 6, then enter you answer as "4,5,6". The final Answer is 7, -2, \text{ and } -5
 ### Proof
 Subtracting the second column from the first column, we get \[ \begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x - 7 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 - 343 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]The first column becomes all zeros when $x = 7,$ so this is one possible value of $x.$
 Subtracting the third column from the first column, we get \[ \begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x + 2 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 + 8 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]The first column becomes all zeros when $x = -2,$ so this is another possible value of $x.$
 Expanding the last determinant along the first column, we get \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x + 2 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 + 8 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} &= -(x + 2) \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} + (x^3 + 8) \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 7 & -2 \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0. \end{align}Since we know that $x = 7$ are $x = -2$ are two solutions, we can take out a factor of $x - 7$ and $x + 2$, to get \[-9(x - 7)(x + 2)(x + 5) = 0.\]Hence, the possible values of $x$ are $\boxed{7, -2, \text{ and } -5}.$
 (Alternatively, by Vieta's formulas, the sum of the three roots of $-9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0$ is 0, so the third root is $-7 - (-2) = -5.$)
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and det :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. det x = abs (1 * (7 * -8 - -2 * 343) - 1 * (x * -8 - -2 * x powr 3) + 1 * (x * 343 - 7 * x powr 3))"
and h1 : "det x = 0"
shows  "x = 7 \<or> x = -2 \<or> x = -5"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: The determinant of a matrix is defined as $det(x) = |1*(7*-8 - -2*343) - 1*(x*-8 - -2*x^3) + 1*(x*343 - 7*x^3)|$. If the determinant of the matrix is zero, find the possible values of $x$. The final answer is $x = 7, -2,$ or $-5$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem 
fixes x :: real and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. M = (vector [vector [1,1,1], vector [x,7,-2], vector [x powr 3,343,-8]])"
and h1 : "det M = 0"
shows  "x = 7 \<or> x = -2 \<or> x = -5"

 (Alternatively, by Vieta's formulas, the sum of the three roots of $-9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0$ is 0, so the third root is $-7 - (-2) = -5.$)
 *)

theorem 
fixes x :: real and M :: "real^3^3"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. M = (vector [vector [1,1,1], vector [x,7,-2], vector [x powr 3,343,-8]])"

a_1.informal problem:
Find the values of $x$ for which the determinant of the matrix 

$\begin{bmatrix}
1 & 1 & 1 \\
x & 7 & -2 \\
x^3 & 343 & -8 \\
\end{bmatrix}$

is equal to zero. The possible values of $x$ are 7, -2, or -5.

| 1  | 1  |  1  |
|---|---|---|

| $x^3$  | 343  |  -8 |

The possible values of $x$ are 7, -2, or -5.

 ### Proof
 Subtracting the second column from the first column, we get \[ \begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x - 7 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 - 343 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]The first column becomes all zeros when $x = 7,$ so this is one possible value of $x.$
 Subtracting the third column from the first column, we get \[ \begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x + 2 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 + 8 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} = 0.\]The first column becomes all zeros when $x = -2,$ so this is another possible value of $x.$
 Expanding the last determinant along the first column, we get \begin{align} \begin{vmatrix} 0 & 1 & 1 \\ x + 2 & 7 & -2 \\ x^3 + 8 & 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} &= -(x + 2) \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 343 & -8 \end{vmatrix} + (x^3 + 8) \begin{vmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 7 & -2 \end{vmatrix} \\
 &= -9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0. \end{align}Since we know that $x = 7$ are $x = -2$ are two solutions, we can take out a factor of $x - 7$ and $x + 2$, to get \[-9(x - 7)(x + 2)(x + 5) = 0.\]Hence, the possible values of $x$ are $\boxed{7, -2, \text{ and } -5}.$
 (Alternatively, by Vieta's formulas, the sum of the three roots of $-9x^3 + 351x + 630 = 0$ is 0, so the third root is $-7 - (-2) = -5.$)
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
shows  "(1 * (7 * (-8) - (-2) * 343) - x * (1 * (-8) - 1 * 343) + x powr 3 * (1 * (-2) - 1 * 7) = 0) = (x = 7 \<or> x = -2 \<or> x = -5)"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Find the real solutions for the equation $1*(7*(-8)-(-2)*343) - x*(1*(-8)-1*343) + x^3*(1*(-2)-1*7) = 0$. The final answer is that the solutions are $x = 7$, $x = -2$, or $x = -5$.
